Continuous Integration

With continuous integration tools, you can run automatic checks - like tests, linters and more - each time you push code to a git repository.

  • Hosted services
  • Self-hosted software

CircleCI

  • 2,500 free credits/week
    (2,500 credits = 250 build minutes)
  • Paid plans starting from $15/month
  • MacOS containers in paid plans
    Docker support
  • 100,000 free credits/week
    for open sources organizations
  • Supports GitHub and Bitbucket
  • Open CircleCI

Codeship

  • $10 free credits/month
    (up to 1,300 service minutes)
  • Paid plans starting from $49/month
  • Codeship Basic plan for
    out-of-the-box workflow
  • Codeship Pro plan for fully customizable Docker boxes
  • Supports GitHub, Bitbucket, Gitlab
  • Open Codeship

Semaphore

  • 100 free private jobs/month
  • Paid plans starting from $29/month
  • Free for open source projects,
    offers educational plans and
    discounts for non-profits
  • Linux and macOS containers
    Docker support
  • Supports GitHub and Bitbucket
  • Open Semaphore

Travis CI

  • Free for open source (public) projects on GitHub (3 concurrent jobs)
  • Paid plans starting from $63/month
    (first 100 builds are free)
  • Plans for students
  • Only supports GitHub
  • Open Travis

Jenkins

  • Free and open source
  • Self-contained, easy to install Java program that you can host yourself
  • 1000+ plugins
  • Cross-platform
  • Open Jenkins

GoCD

  • Free and open source
  • Paid support provided by ThoughtWorks
  • Multiple plugins
  • Cross-platform
  • Open GoCD

Affiliate links

Affiliate links have a special code in the URL. If you register from this link, some companies will give free credits to either both of us or just to me (depending on how a company set up their affiliation program - I always ask if they have some coupon codes that will give credits to both sides). Those credits can be used on their website (for a few months of free hosting, a cheaper domain, etc.) or redeemed for money (only for domains providers).

Affiliation program doesn't affect whether a company is recommended or not. You can read more about how I select companies/tools on the About & contact page.
